memberdef.name: HDF5MasterBuffer

briefdescription.para: Constructor.
Destructor.
Empty all buffers to disk.

detaileddescription.para: Empty all buffers to disk (or as much of them as is currently possible in RA case)

inbodydescription.para: While we are here, check that buffered_points and buffered_points_set are the same size

briefdescription.para: Print metadata directly to disk.
Clear all data in buffers and on disk for this printer.
Make sure all buffers know about all points in all buffers.

detaileddescription.para: Make sure all buffers know about all points in all buffers Should not generally be necessary if points are added in the "normal" way. Only needed in special circumstances (e.g. when receiving points from another process).

briefdescription.para: Report whether all the buffers are empty.
Report what sort of buffers we are managing.
Report status of non-empty buffers (as a string message)
Report what output file we are targeting.
Report which group in the output file we are targeting.
Report the name of the metadata group on this file.
Report length of buffer for HDF5 output.
Report number of points currently in the buffer.
Extend all datasets to the specified size;.
Search the existing output and find the highest used pointIDs for each rank.
Open (and lock) output HDF5 file and obtain HDF5 handles.
Close (and unlock) output HDF5 file and release HDF5 handles.
Retrieve the location_id specifying where output should be created in the HDF5 file.
Retrieve the metadata_id where the metadata should be created in the HDF5 file.
Get next available position in the synchronised output datasets.

detaileddescription.para: Determine the next free index in the output datasets.

briefdescription.para: Get the next position for metadata entries.

detaileddescription.para: Determine the next position for metadata entries.

briefdescription.para: Report number of buffers that we are managing.
Report upper limit estimate of size of all buffer data in MB.
Get names and types of all datasets in the group that we are pointed at.

detaileddescription.para: Get names of all datasets in the group that we are pointed at.

briefdescription.para: Retrieve a map containing pointers to all buffers managed by this object.
Retrieve set containing all points currently known to be in these buffers.
Remove points from buffer tracking.
Add base class pointer for a buffer to master buffer map.

detaileddescription.para: Add base class point for a buffer to master buffer map.

inbodydescription.para: Not already in the map; add it

detaileddescription.para: Inform all buffers that data has been written to certain mpirank/pointID pair They will make sure that they have an output slot for this pair, so that all the buffers for this printer stay "synchronised".

briefdescription.para: Obtain positions in output datasets for a buffer of points.
Ensure HDF5 file is open (and locked for us to use)
Map containing pointers to all buffers managed by this object;.

detaileddescription.para: Vector of PPIDpairs that are currently stored in the printer buffers This also defines the order in which points should ultimately be written to disk (we will tell the buffers what order to print stuff, they don't track the ordering themselves).
We also need a set of the buffered points, so we can do fast lookup of whether a point is in the buffer or not.

briefdescription.para: Flag to specify what sort of buffer this manager is supposed to be managing.
Max allowed size of buffer.
Output file variales.
File locking object for the output hdf5 file.
Buffer manager objects.

memberdef.name: schedule_print

briefdescription.para: Queue up data to be written to disk when buffers are full.

inbodydescription.para: Check if the point is known to be in the buffers already
While we are here, check that buffered_points and buffered_points_set are the same size
This is a new point! See if buffers are full and need to be flushed
Sync buffers exceeded the allowed size somehow
RA buffers may not have been able to fully flush, so check their length and report if it is getting big.
Attempt to flush again every 1000 points beyond buffer limits

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the buffer for a given output label (and type)
Specialisation declarations for 'get_buffer' function for each buffer type.

detaileddescription.para: Class to manage all buffers for a given printer object Also handles the file locking/access to the output file
